title: AD-AS graph - MP action to restore FE

content.question: Assume the economy is currently in short-run equilibrium at point D, as shown in the graph provided, and that the banking system has limited reserves. Which of the following is a monetary policy action that would restore long-run equilibrium?

choices.label: An open-market purchase of government bonds, which would move the economy to point <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>
An open-market sale of government bonds, which would move the economy to point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>
An increase in the required reserve ratio, which would move the economy to point <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>
An increase in government spending, which would move the economy to point <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>
An increase in taxes, which would move the economy to point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>

content.answer: An open-market sale of government bonds, which would move the economy to point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
